body: I can't read much from the error message: It seems like a module couldn't be found in the child compilation. Not sure why.

I have the same problem. Build fails by starting task on Jenkins with grunt.
When I start ng build with sudo grunts on target folder all is good.
This problem doesn't performs on local Win 7 build.

Webpack: 4.29.6
Node.js: 8.11.3
OS: Ubuntu
mini-css-extract-plugin 0.5.0

Thanks for your report. It would be great if you reduce your issue to a small reproducible example. Best put this example into a github repository together with instructions how to get to the problem.

same issue here:

ERROR in ./src/styles.scss
Module build failed (from /bitrise/src/node_modules/mini-css-extract-plugin/dist/loader.js):
TypeError: Cannot read property 'identifier' of null
    at text.map.line (/bitrise/src/node_modules/mini-css-extract-plugin/dist/loader.js:134:32)
    at Array.map (<anonymous>)
    at childCompiler.runAsChild (/bitrise/src/node_modules/mini-css-extract-plugin/dist/loader.js:131:21)

    at hooks.afterCompile.callAsync.err (/bitrise/src/node_modules/webpack/lib/Compiler.js:631:15)
    at AsyncSeriesHook.eval [as callAsync] (eval at create (/bitrise/src/node_modules/tapable/lib/HookCodeFactory.js:32:10), <anonymous>:15:1)
    at AsyncSeriesHook.lazyCompileHook (/bitrise/src/node_modules/tapable/lib/Hook.js:154:20)

    at AsyncSeriesHook.eval [as callAsync] (eval at create (/bitrise/src/node_modules/tapable/lib/HookCodeFactory.js:32:10), <anonymous>:15:1)

    at AsyncSeriesHook.eval [as callAsync] (eval at create (/bitrise/src/node_modules/tapable/lib/HookCodeFactory.js:32:10), <anonymous>:6:1)
    at AsyncSeriesHook.lazyCompileHook (/bitrise/src/node_modules/tapable/lib/Hook.js:154:20)
    at hooks.optimizeChunkAssets.callAsync.err (/bitrise/src/node_modules/webpack/lib/Compilation.js:1320:32)

I got the same problem in angular cli build, I was using a webpack version too recent 4.32 it works with the 4.29 one

Same here. The bug occurs only with the production build (ng build --prod). 

I'm running Windows 10 (but I don't think the OS doesn't make any difference)

Here's a reproducer: https://github.com/opitzconsulting/ui-frontend-integration/tree/webpack-issue-9156

The repository actually is a monorepository containing four projects. Luckily, each of the projects is simple. You can reproduce the bug in less than five minutes. Follow these steps:

* checkout the repo
* git checkout webpack-issue-9156
* cd into the new folder
* cd basket/source/basket
* npm install
* ng build --prod

Now you should see the error. It's a regression between 4.31.0 and 4.32.0.

@sokra here is the smallest example https://github.com/roblan/webpack-issue-9156

line https://github.com/roblan/webpack-issue-9156/blob/master/webpack.config.js#L21 seems to introduce the problem.

@stephanrauh we got the same issue on Windows 10 and Linux (Windows Subsystem with Ubuntu and Jenkins on RHEL).
Also the node version does not matter, so it must be a problem somewhere in the webpack stack, as already reproduced.

Hello, i found the problem

in file:///../node_modules/mini-css-extract-plugin/dist/loader.js

in this line
`try {
      text = exec(this, source, request);   
      locals = text && text.locals;`

the variable "source" has wrong generated code string

![Снимок](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12134542/58103563-dbff8d80-7beb-11e9-9e4f-1d54a24fec5e.PNG)

expected module.i (has value), but is module.id (is undefined)

Does anyone know where the value of the variable "source" is generated?

*Update 
So, it looks like an error in the file webpack/lib/MainTemplate.js. Object "module" is created with the property "i" but without the property "id" (in my case - module.i === 'iDYi', module.id === undefined). after that, the module is registered to exports, where it tries to take the value of the module.id ( == undefined)

*Update2
So, i update this line in MainTemplate.js ("webpack": "^4.32.0") and, after that, all compiled fine
![Снимок](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12134542/58130484-c5295d00-7c24-11e9-8c56-0eae18f610dc.PNG)
Very good, I've been trying to find the problem all day.

issue.title: node: false should not disable CommonJs features

repository.name: webpack
repository.description: A bundler for javascript and friends. Packs many modules into a few bundled assets. Code Splitting allows for loading parts of the application on demand. Through "loaders", modules can be CommonJs, AMD, ES6 modules, CSS, Images, JSON, Coffeescript, LESS, ... and your custom stuff.

body: should be fixed in 4.32.1
Version 4.32.1 fixed it. Great work!
Yeah fixed. Thank you. Great and fast work!
Thanks guys
I'm impressed by your fast reaction. Keep up the good work!
Version 4.32.1 fixed it. Working fine. Thanks!
Please fix that

@OtabekSadiridinov Several people confirmed above that the bug has been fixed. So I suppose you should add a few words what happened. What are you trying to do? Which version of the plugin are you using? What does the error look like on your machine? I guess you also need to open a new issue. This issue is closed. Probably it'll slip the attention of the team.
